cons: Lack of advancement opportunities from this position in the Nashville office, perceived favoritism for some team members, capped pay and removal of bonus structure. Slow to backfill positions when people leave. There's also a lot of turnover in the customer support department.

headline: Excellent environment. Amazing talent.
pros: Eventbrite has an amazing company culture. Aside from the general ideas most have about "culture" (casual dress code, ping pong, kegs in the kitchen -- all of which we have), the environment is one built on transparency and trust. Everyone at Eventbrite understands the mission, vision, and values of the company and works incredibly hard to make their own contributions -- as an individual and as part of a team. Not only that, but they love doing it. You walk into Eventbrite and you know instantly that it's a place people love to be. That speaks to the amazing collective of executive leadership, team managers, and top notch talent.
cons: Like any large business, sometimes it takes time to make large scale changes to the process or product. The most important thing to know is that constant improvement is key to every aspect of the business. While changes might not be able to take effect overnight, they are always acknowledged, heard, and followed through to realization.

headline: Great place to work, very flexible!
pros:
Pros:
Very flexible scheduling
Mostly work from home
All necessary equipment provided
Excellent benefits (medical, dental, vision, wellness reimbursement, work from home stipend)
Compensation is very competitive
Co-workers are all very friendly and easy to get along with
cons:
Cons:
Company is a little disorganized
Policies and procedures are changed very frequently, so it's sometimes hard to keep up
Management is not always aligned on policies, but team leads are given near-absolute authority

headline: I love this place!
pros:
- Strong culture of learning and development
- Amazing talent
- Nice people
- Focus on sustainable business practices
- Leaders are very transparent 
- Great employee perks
cons: None! But there is a 5 word minimum for this field... so I'm typing typing typing...

headline: A Great Choice
pros: Eventbrite is a forward thinking company.  Having worked for some very large organizations throughout my career, I can say that what makes Eventbrite unique is that it has the established processes and leadership structures in place that feel like a big corporation, but the culture, ethos, and workplace are still very rooted in the fun and exciting startup mentality.  With cutting edge benefits like free daily lunch, all you can eat snacks (lots of choices), and a "take the time you need" PTO policy, Eventbrite has positioned itself to be a unique employer.
cons: At times, the startup mentality can clash with the need for corporate-like processes, creating a push-pull for resources.

headline: Great Work/Life Balance
pros:
I'd heard people talk about the idea of work/life balance...but had never worked anywhere where it was a reality. But people here truly do have lives outside of work and management understands/encourages that. People leave early when they need to or WFH if necessary - and while it doesn't seem like people abuse it, they do seem to actually use the unlimited vacation policy. Not to say people aren't hard working and there definitely are the occasional late nights, but it's not an environment of sticking around late just to be seen at your desk late.

For the most part, the people are smart, motivated and "cool" which makes for a nice working environment. Plus good office perks!
cons:
While I do feel like the company is moving in the right direction, it feels a bit disorganized. Less than ideal communication/alignment between departments leads to what feels like constant strategy/direction changes. 

Pay is not great, not are the raises.

headline: 5+ years and going strong!
pros:
• People
• Fast-paced work environment (never a dull day)
• Benefits
• Perks (catered meals, snacks, juice bar, etc.)
• Opportunities for professional development
cons: The one con that comes to mind is the disconnect between offices/locations. While not necessary to interface with everyone in the company on a consistent basis, there are names I don't know and haven't heard before. Further, when meeting a "new" team member, it's not uncommon to learn they've been with the company for 6 months or more—which can be a bit awkward and embarrassing. As any company grows, this is expected (to not know every person in the organization), so it's only a minor issue and not one that weighs heavily on my decision to stick with the company.

headline: Customer Experience Review
pros: Great benefits, exciting atmosphere, supportive leaders.
cons: Lack of career growth, overzealous company culture, poor comp.

headline: Fun company overflowing with talent
pros:
- Really talented and super friendly workforce
- Upper management really cares about its employees
- Lots of transparency
- Excellent career growth opportunities
- Good/Great perks (unlimited time-off, 7 meals a week, tech company office)
- Awesome learning opportunities (weekly subject matter expert chats, career advice, etc)
- They take their culture and values seriously
- Hiring is tough, but it ensures they let the best in the door
cons: - The company is in profitability mode, so don't expect weekly company sponsored happy hours or extravagant off-sites. For most this might be par for the course, but coming from a company that was, admittedly, a little over the top with that stuff, Eventbrite just tends to be mindful about how they spend

headline: Great culture with expected growth pains
pros: Incredible benefits. Promotions are given to those that deserve them. Compensation is fair. Opportunities for OT.
cons: Pain points when trying to move into other areas of the company. Some have found it difficult to move laterally or vertically from their current positions.

headline: Excellent company to work for and one that cares about it's employees
pros:
Some of the perks:  Excellent Benefits, Team Outings, Free Lunch, High Performance Culture, comfortable workspace, Wellness Benefit, Great coworkers.

 The management and executive staff truly values the employees and there is a constant importance placed on the overall well-being of employees. 

There is also importance placed on career progression and the company holds excellent learning/career development opportunities each month.
cons: Very few, if any. You need to be able to adapt quickly to change, but that is only a con if you're not prepared for change! The pay isn't as much as I made at my previous employer, but the benefits make up for the lower wages.

headline: Outstanding company!
pros: It has been an amazing experience to be a part of this company. The culture and work environment are awesome and everybody is extremely supportive of one another. I couldn't ask for a better work/life balance (in my position, you can work from home!) and the benefits are outstanding. Our leadership is fantastic and transparent about changes within the company. You feel like you are actually a part of something rather than just another employee.
cons: The only thing that comes to mind, and I wouldn't necessarily call it a con since this is a growing company, but it would be great to have a clearer sense in regard to career growth and opportunities. I understand that with a company growing this quickly, changes happen frequently so it is difficult to really pinpoint a career path.

headline: Bringing People Together--the best people!
pros:
Fabulous people; great environment. 
Eventbrite exists to "Bring People Together through the Experience of Live Events". The amazing part is the company lives out its mission in the way they bring work teams together. It is a warm, welcoming, fun culture that encourages innovation and collaboration. For a tech company that allows employees to work remotely, Eventbrite is intentional about cultivating a fun, positive, high performance, high-relationship culture.
cons:
If you're not comfortable in an environment that is always evolving and constantly changing, Eventbrite would not be a good fit for you. 

Because it is a constantly evolving product and workplace, clear career tracks aren't immediately discernible.

headline: Great company, great culture!
pros: Eventbrite is a wonderful place to work. There is an overall culture of trust, openness and transparency that is truly unique for a company this size. Most individuals and teams are extremely collaborative and cross-functional dynamics are very strong. Benefits, perks and work/life balance are excellent. There is a great mix of small-company drive and energy and larger-company maturity.
cons: Would be good to have clearer career growth opportunities. A few growing pains, but to be expected at this stage in the company's evolution.

headline: Wonderful People and Company
pros:
One of the best parts about working for Eventbrite is the people. You become friends with so many people you work with making your experience there that much greater.

The benefits are amazing, but nothing beats the flexibility and time off. 

The leadership completely trusts its employees to do their jobs, so there's no micro-managing.

There is great opportunity for growth and to acquire new skills if you make the effort.

It is fulfilling to be a part of a company that touches so many lives.
cons:
Cross-departmental communication can sometimes be weak.

There can sometimes be a lack of standardization of processes before implementing new products.

headline: So grateful to be a part of this team!
pros: The culture here is amazing. Everyone is so supportive, welcoming, and talented! Leadership is phenomenal, and they do a fantastic job of not only encouraging you to be your best self, but also providing you with the organizational foundation to do so. The benefits are also top notch--Unlimited paid time off, catered lunches, wellness stipend, work from home option, and GREAT health care! This isn't just another job--the people here really care about Eventbrite's mission & core values, and they work hard to make sure the company is successful, sustainable, and always interesting!
cons: There really aren't any negatives in my opinion. For Customer Experience roles, the work schedule might be less than ideal for some because support is 24/7, but it certainly isn't unmanageable by any means, and there is plenty of flexibility.

headline: Positive culture, challenging work
pros:
- Super smart, kind, and interesting coworkers. People always want to do better and generally want to be helpful.
- Work that helps people all over the world do cool things off the internet.
- Strong emphasis on culture beyond perks.
- Trusted with interesting, challenging work.
cons:
- Positive to a fault sometimes. You have to be likeable to make things happen.
- Top company priorities shift too often and aren't always communicated well. We try to do too many huge things at once and then not much happens.

headline: My Experience at Eventbrite
pros:
I've been at Eventbrite for over 5 years and I've watched myself and my career develop and change as a direct result of working for a company that invests in its people. I trust Eventbrite to do the right thing by me, and I think that's invaluable to find in a company. 

- Eventbrite hires amazing people you WANT to work with
- I always look forward to coming to work 
- The culture is always evolving and changing in the best way possible
- Britelings are empowered to get s*** done
- We invest in our leaders and individual contributors growth
- There's a ton of internal mobility opportunities
- You have the flexibility to work from wherever you want
- Take the time you need is a real thing
- Leadership trusts that you'll do the right thing and provides an autonomous environment
cons: As such a tenured employee, it's challenging to reach competitive compensation. You almost feel like you'd need to leave and come back in order to make what's competitive.

headline: Remote
pros:
I've worked in tiny startups my entire engineering career, and was rather nervous entering into what I believe to be "corporate" status. My largest concern was getting lost in the shuffle, and my product not mattering to anybody nearly as much as it mattered to me. Our company, Queue, was acquired by Eventbrite because of our ability to build so much with such a small team (currently, 3 engineers).  The two attributes of Eventbrite, and the team surrounding the acquisition, was recognizing that and making sure we stayed relatively autonomous, yet still "included" (if that makes sense).

If you want the juice, here it is:
* Medical/Dental/Vision benefits are incredible, and the employer covers quite a large portion of dependent coverage as well
* Pay is adequate.  Not the most I've been offered in the city, but provides for a great quality of life while my partner is able to stay home and raise our child
* Catered lunches in the main offices (since we work remote, they add a lunch allowance) are always delicious
* Snacks, Red Bull, all the fuel you need throughout the day
* Top of the line hardware, I didn't have to haggle for extra RAM or CPU, I was just given the best and latest MBP upon arrival
cons: There is a singular con (I've been working here for six months), and I don't believe it to be a fault of Eventbrite, but the fault of a company with any size: meetings. As I've stated before, I've worked in tiny companies.  To push an idea forward, somebody had to say something out loud. In a room of 10 people max, it always gets heard.  With a company of 300+ in one office you have to schedule a meeting. That meeting may not include all the people whose life you will touch with your decision, so more meetings are had. Decisions are, then, inherently slow.

headline: Fantastic culture, world-class product, awesome employees, and room to improve
pros:
• Transparency on company priorities, product roadmap and decisions, and our performance against them
• Supportive culture that encourages vulnerability and individuality
• Access and frequent interaction with senior leaders
• Culture of feedback and challenging the status quo
• Great perks - wellness stipend, daily catered lunch, ability to work from home, wonderful office snacks and drinks, fun events away from the office
cons:
• We've grown quickly and also change/pivot strategy quickly. These decisions affect our product and work and can be confusing for some (both Britelings and our customers).
• It doesn't seem like we always listen to feedback from our internal teams and external customers. While our product is always evolving, we still haven't made progress against many of our customers' pain points.

headline: Great Environment to work and grow with
pros: Great work life balance, good and helpful culture, people want to see you succeed and help each other a lot, very casual and friendly environment. Teams are small so you get to learn a lot!
cons: Some growing pains as the company is still growing

headline: Super duper!
pros:
* Everyone is really nice! - At first i was a little bit skeptical because the people seemed to nice, but it is genuine.
* Big but not to big - Eventbrite is big so you get the luxuries from that, but not to big that an individual can't make a difference / impact.
* Great Projects - Eventbrite is product focused so you get the build the things users need.
cons:
* Career progression after senior engineer level is unclear.
* Paternity leave period is shorter than other similar companies.

headline: Nashville Sales
pros: I started working at Eventbrite at the beginning of 2016. I had an amazing interview and onboarding experience and have really enjoyed working here as we build the Sales Team in Nashville. We are a performance-driven organization and have hit the ground running since our first team exited newhire training in April. We now have 4 Sales Teams in Nashville: SDRs, Small Business, Mid Market and Customer Success - which means there are plenty of opportunities to grow your career as the business continues to grow. In addition, we are highly customer-centric and celebrate our organizers' success with their events. Finally, Eventbrite emphasizes a great culture and we have a lot of fun while we work hard. There are tons of learning opportunities, team-building events, and opportunities for every-day fun on the rows.
cons: I can't think of any...

headline: Senior Software Engineer
pros: Eventbrite has provided great opportunities for grown in the directions that I am most interested in. I work with, mentor and am mentored by some of the most intelligent people that I have every worked with.
cons: We're growing fast and moving into new cities and new offices. Sometimes we feel the pressure of  distributed teams. There are certain ways that I would like to contribute that are made difficult by the distributed nature of our teams.

headline: Come work with the best Nashville has to offer!
pros: The culture at Eventbrite is amazing. Friendly people, excellent work environment, great perks, and the location is great, right near downtown in Cummins Station. The work we do lets people share meaningful experiences with their friends and families.
cons: Sometimes we have too many meetings.

headline: Great place to work and grow
pros:
For me it starts with a great product, bringing people together for live events. I've gotten to understand and experience what putting on a good live event means and exposure to music, art, food that I wouldn't have otherwise.

Eventbrite has a people oriented culture. Cannot stress enough how much of a difference this makes in the day to day. There are offices around the globe with interesting and friendly coworkers pushing towards the same goal.

I've been able to grow in both the technical and personal. It definitely feels like a family of people pushing each other to give their best and make sure we are achieving both professional and personal goals. There are big challenges at significant scale on the engineering side and the best part about it all really is the team that comes together to solve them.
cons: The company has grown out of it's true start up roots. There are processes and plans to follow, not too much and not too little for my taste but it's not the wild west anymore.

headline: Great people, great mission, great execution
pros:
I get the opportunity to work on innovative solutions with super smart people who are fun to be around. Difficult employees or negative interactions are almost non-existent. Leadership team is superior, as are the engineers I work with every day. Love that we have built a global engineering team.

Company is having success, and I get to learn and have fun every day. Hard to ask for much more than that. I also feel that my contributions are valued.
cons: Our target markets are very broad, so we have a ton of surface area to cover. Huge opportunity, but also stressful to try to do all of it. Still, I'm glad we do a few too many things rather than a few too few. I think the breadth of our offering is a big reason we are successful where competitors fail.

headline: Dead brand and direction, High turnover, Blameshifting, No Meritocracy
pros: A real 10-4 job, flexibility to work from home many days since product roadmaps aren't compelling or aggressive
cons: Eventbrite was an admired brand in '08-'10 full of Stanford grads but many have since moved on and replaced by folks from dying brands like eBay and Twitter. Ticketing/e-commerce is now commoditized SAAS and the company's "strategic" projects has failed to deliver any differentiation. Both Product and Strategy teams have abandoned the marketplace mission as they struggle to make Eventbrite a destination page for event discovery. Instead the team executes multi-year efforts on refreshing the look and feel of the website to occupy time and without substantial metrics impact. The Engineering team moves at glacial speeds and mostly comes from other events-oriented SAAS companies (read: never worked at pedigree like Google, Facebook, Amazon, Microsoft, etc). This breads an engineering culture that lacks real processes or documentation. The "bench strength" has never worked on large-scale services at aforementioned firms and thus many of its services/experiences have broken under larger loads. This lack of know-how also creates a fear of touching legacy code, building hack upon hack. Recent acquisitions have built off-shore engineering centers making it even harder to develop. With compensation well below market rate and and unknown equity value, more subpar talent is recruited. Meritocracy doesn't exist and only those that are willing to endure the poor culture eventually get promoted after 3+ yrs or brown-nosing.

headline: Great place to work despite scattered leadership
pros: I absolutely loved my job because of the exciting problems my team tackled. The perks are great and the people are even better. There are some truly incredible employees at Eventbrite! I would absolutely recommend Eventbrite to a friend.
cons:
- Everyone in the office knows what you're talking about when you say "the shiny new thing". Senior leadership seems pitted against each other and the employees are forced to shift gears whenever one of them comes out on top. One day it's mobile, the next day it could be Eventbrite hair care products (you can never predict it). 

- Nepotism seems like a problem you'd never encounter in your adult life, but it's a reality at Eventbrite. I've seen someone placed in a position that they were not qualified to handle. I've seen a different person repeatedly make big promises, sink a ton of money into them, and have nothing to show for it. It's difficult to ignore the relationships they have with executives and how those relationships influence what's expected of them. At the end of the day, they'll still be employed and the projects swept under the rug. This subject was only discussed behind closed doors, but was a huge distraction and had a negative impact on the morale of many of my coworkers. Middle management would never surface it in fear for their own standing, which I completely understand.

headline: Amazing Place to Work
pros: Fantastic place to work. Incredible opportunity, lots of support and training, and a management team that cares and is vested in our success. I feel so fortunate to work with such high integrity, smart people, who are passionate and supportive. Such a fabulous place to work and grow my career. I can't imagine being anywhere else!!! Really wonderful environment and a great place to sell. Best solution in the market, with huge upside and aggressive compensation plan!
cons: I can't think of any. I really appreciate the opportunity to work here and benefit from the experience.

headline: Review
pros: sexy brand, with fun employees
cons: pays under market, high turnover

headline: Lots of room to grow, excellent leadership
pros:
This company has had a lot of thought and energy invested into making it a place people want to work.  The leadership team is intentionally and remarkably transparent. For example, we have a weekly open Q&A session with the CEO, in which surprisingly pointed and difficult questions are asked by employees and answered with grace and intelligence.

Every part of the company seems populated by competent, motivated, and intelligent people. On the engineering side, I've had the privilege to work with colleagues I respect and admire. Feedback is part of the development cycle, and these same people are generally willing to jump in and take a look at work to suggest improvements, best practices, and architecture.  Things get improved constantly because developers have the motivation and leeway to make changes when they see a problem.

An astoundingly good daily lunch, snacks, lots of office events that are actually fun, and a great healthcare plan are some notable perks.
cons:
The original application was created in the mid aughts, and like many companies that have been around for a while, there are ugly parts of the codebase.

We use a small number of in-house tools which have dominant open source alternatives.  Mastering these tools has taught some valuable core concepts, but ultimately knowing how to use them will not be a transferable skill.

headline: Software Engineer
pros: Colleagues are smart, down-to-earth, and helpful. Really supportive atmosphere for newer engineers who are willing to ask for help - everyone is happy to answer questions and take time to go over new concepts. Ego does not get in the way. Management is available and transparent. Remote employees are first-class citizens. Great benefits. Family-friendly office culture is reflected both in company policy and actions of employees up and down the corporate ladder.
cons: Navigating the time difference with colleagues working 10-6 in SF creates some logistical hurdles. Work is ongoing around onboarding, goal setting and career ladder processes, which aren't fully ironed out.

headline: Great job
pros:
-WFH
-in-office chef made lunch
-understanding management
-positive culture
-tech centered
cons:
-transparency 
-scheduling
-inflexible at times
-pay
-raise structure

headline: Marketing
pros: I felt welcome at Eventbrite right from day one which is definitely something unique. The culture here is amazing and the work/life balance is better than any other company I have worked for yet. It was obvious to me after a few weeks how much Eventbrite values its employees which is something that is necessary for a positive, long-term career.
cons: I have only been here for 6 months and have yet to experience anything negative thus far.

headline: UK office
pros:
Great team, culture and atmosphere. Growing aggressively both in size and stature. An office of committed and open people.
Great technology in a market ready for disruption.
cons: With high growth there will always be some growing pains but nothing out of the ordinary

headline: Great people to work with - not a great company to work for outside of the US
pros:
* Excellent team with lots of knowledge
* Great company to have on your CV
cons:
* They don't really care about the offices outside of the US - micro managed
* Impossible to move up in the company unless you are already in a senior role
* Management does not know how to motivate team and create a positive working environment

headline: Great people. Lack of coordination.
pros: The folks at the company are generally super smart, caring, trustworthy, and just the kind of people that you want to hang out with. There's a good mix of employees from various backgrounds (both professionally and personally) and they tend to be bright, friendly, and incredibly interesting. Work/life balance is highly valued and (usually) totally feasible. The leadership tends to clearly communicate objectives across the company. Those objectives are sound and responsible in the current business climate.
cons: There's a lot of stagnation. Come here for the experience and the name. But, don't come here expecting to make bank, grow into a higher position, or collaborate with other teams. Salaries are not competitive and either are the career advancement opportunities.

headline: Great Culture and Ambition
pros:
- Fast-paced work environment
- Company has big ambitions to change the live events industry
- Tactical acquisitions to gain technology and talent
cons: - Big ambitions can be hard to focus efforts.  There are big expectations from all employees and teams are spread thin across many of the focus areas.

headline: Amazing place for growth and supportive co-workers
pros:
- Growth mindset: The Engineering department is very encouraging of growth and learning. We have weekly "safe space" code labs for those new to programming, as well as weekly talks on front end or general eng topics and an engineering book club (with reimbursement). We also have a strong pair programming culture and the leadership actively encourages this.
- Make it happen culture: If you have a great idea, you're encouraged to go and get support for it, you don't have to jump through a bunch of hoops to implement it. 
- Belief in talent: If you're talented and have potential, but maybe not experience, Eventbrite will give you the opportunities you need to get where you want to go, and will take a chance on you. So many people have moved roles and teams here because of this part of our culture. 
- The people: It is refreshing to come to work and have teammates that genuinely are happy to be here. We have a range of personalities that makes it interesting to come to work every day. Plus, our Male:Female ratio is one of the best in tech, especially in Engineering, and this helps create a supportive, safe, encouraging environment for everyone.
- Good benefits: free lunch 4x, breakfast 1x, dinner 2x per week. Lots of snacks, juice bar, nap room, normal healthcare options, transit stipend, wellness stipend, unlimited time off, and a great location!
cons:
- Product team needs higher expectations and more resources. Some PMs are wonderful, but others have too much on their plate and cannot provide adequate support to their teams. 
- As we scale, we're starting to become a little more corporate with some processes. This is not always a bad thing, as it helps us become more efficient, but sometimes the result is a loss of customer-focus.

headline: Good place to work but morale and opportunities are on the decline!
pros: People and perks: The people who work here for the most part are amazing, smart and supportive. The perks (fully covered health care, food, unlimited PTO, etc. ) are competitive though the salaries are far from it. Communication amongst peers is casual and friendly, most of the teams spend time together outside of the office which is a plus.
cons: Leadership plays favorites in a way that undervalues other team members. Salaries are unacceptably low. It seems that every quarter there's a new person favorited at the expense of other team members. We're told that if we want to make more money we should sell more (which is a fairly antiquated rationale - though we do all understand we're there to bring in revenue for the business) but then opportunities are taken away from us for the benefit of new or individual team members. This is felt across the board.

headline: The best work environment I have ever experienced
pros: Amazing team of very smart people who all love coming to work each day, everyones opinion is highly valued regardless of your position or time at the company. Senior management are very transparent and the work environment that has been created sets everyone up for success.
cons: Can be harder to execute when outside of the US as there is still reliance on the US team for certain things, but these processes are being improved constantly.

headline: Great, and just getting better!
pros: Strong company vision and strategy, high confidence in senior leadership to execute on our strategy, a supportive and brilliant team in a fantastic work environment that makes it easy to come to work everyday.  We are all rowing in the same direction, and it feels good!
cons: The following are not really cons, but the reality of the current climate: We have aggressive goals, and you will need to be able to adapt constantly to a changing environment.  If you want to grow, take responsibility for your growth and ask for development opportunities.

headline: Eventbrite
pros:
great work culture
great product
lots of nice perks
cons:
product changes a lot and sometimes planning can be difficult for mgmt to juggle. 

adaptability/flexibility necessary more than with many jobs

headline: Great culture
pros: No matter what role you are in, you have the autonomy to work with anyone in the company. Its such a supportive environment to develop your skills and learn from everyone. There is a lot of transparency from senior managers and they do a good job to connect to all global offices. I have never worked for a company where I feel as valued as I do now.
cons: Communication can always be clearer but I think thats the same in a lot of companies.

headline: Review from a long-time employee
pros:
Eventbrite is an amazing place to work. I've been here for almost 5 years now and it has only gotten better over time. The work is interesting, the people are great, and the work-life balance actually lets you have a life.
One particular thing I love about working here is that our companyis aligned with helping all of our customers - both organizers and consumers. We're not like other companies who rely on selling your data to advertisers; we benefit when our event organizers put on great events and when our consumers find awesome events to attend.
cons: In my time here, I think one of the consequences of the fantastic people we hire is that everyone is _too_ nice, and it's hard to give and receive critical feedback.

headline: Outstanding Business Combined with An Exceptional Culture
pros: Everyone here is incredibly passionate about the brand promise: bringing live events (aka bucket list/memorable experiences) to the masses.  But below that surface, there's an incredibly rich diversity of A+ talent in this company.  Rarely do you find a place where you come in and have a challenging but incredibly fun day and leave the office slightly better at your craft than when you came in.  If you are going to spend 80% of your waking hours working in tech, you can't find a better place than Eventbrite.
cons: The commute can be long if you live outside the city.

headline: Awesome culture, awesome business
pros: Eventbrite is a fast-growing business where you can learn something new every day. The culture emphasizes collaboration, honesty and day-to-day fun. It's a brand you can be proud of too; who doesn't appreciate the fact that Eventbrite democratized the ticketing industry and has collected the world's largest online treasure trove of live events?
cons: Location is optimized for BART riders and anyone living in the city. If you live on the peninsula and need to take the train, it is a 20-minute walk from the station.

headline: Customer Service Team Review
pros: We have the ability to work from home but the office is also really great. My co-workers are the best and the team leads are amazing as well. I love the values of the company and feel that executive leadership has a great strategy and genuinely care about the employees. The benefits can't be beat! This makes me want to bring my best to work every day.
cons: Upper management in customer service lacks good communication and they are very reactive. They make a lot of changes with little thought to how it affects the team or their morale. Sometimes, they'll make a big change then take our feedback and backtrack on the change instead of bringing us into the picture earlier on which could avoid a lot of issues. When the office opened there was a lot of talk about never becoming a call center and about career growth.  We've definitely moved more toward a call center mentality though. The value of work-life balance doesn't seem to be a priority anymore unfortunately.

headline: Not perfect, but the best place I've worked
pros: Eventbrite is comprised of talented, ambitious people who are genuine and pleasant to be around. The product and purpose of the company is impactful on the quality of people's lives, and provides a meaningful focus for day-to-day work. As the company has grown, so too have the employees, not only in headcount, but also in individual professional advancement.
cons: As a mid-sized company, it is still maturing and trying to find its cultural and operational footing as it emerges from its "startup" phase. As en employee, there are opportunities for professional growth, but they are not always clearly mapped out, nor are roles always very well defined.

headline: Autonomy and Support, Grown Up Style
pros: Eventbrite rewards capability with autonomy and collaboration with tremendous support from the team. I am routinely surprised by how much initiative people show and help they offer on things I am working on. The company is also very accepting of developing into new areas and supportive of employees who want to explore new roles.
cons: Our focus on driving efficiency and making the business able to fund itself have restricted headcount growth in recent quarters, but despite the environment we are accelerating hiring because of the progress we have made, albeit at more modest levels than what the Valley typically does. So this is not the place to come if you believe success is measured by how big the team is or your career goals include managing lots of people.

headline: Team Lead
pros: Lots of flexibility, work from home when needed, great benefits, lots of perks. Everyone is part of high level strategies.
cons: Ever changing environment, sometimes inconsistency

headline: Learned a lot, made many friends
pros: Fun environment, great people, room to grow. Met many people I would gladly have a beer with any day of the week.
cons: While everyone is very positive, I found it hard to get critical feedback from managers. Interview processes didn't scale well past 200 people.

headline: Great place to work everyday!
pros: Free cooked lunch, unlimited healthy snacks, lots of natural light, amazing office with vibrant colors and a great use of space where there are no back seats, positive energy people, a place you are excited to go to everyday, best entry level, transparent communication with CEOs and entire executive staff, you feel involved in decisions and have constant opportunities to voices opinions and questions.
cons: None so far, it is still a startup so there are of course changes but they all seem to be positive changes and for the best of the company and employees.

headline: Great company for engineers who want growth & learning
pros: I have worked at many companies, small & big, but never anything like EventBrite. This is the greatest company for engineers who want to learn, grow, and collaborate with others. They have a team of engineers who are really smart but at the same time very personable. There are some very experienced people working alongside Hackbright or new college grads; they have little work areas setup where a group can congregate and do some pairing together. The culture at EventBrite seems to fit the individual; if you're the type who wants to work alone, that's fine, but if you need help, just ask for it. I haven't met a single person I would hesitate to work with. We have 2 remote engineering teams in Mendoza and Nashville, both of these teams are great and easy to work with. To break up the work we host meetups, have beer on tap, clap when we are excited about something, and give out gnome awards. The office in San Francisco is very cool, we have an open work environment, but I also love going into the big Library (no talking allowed) for some quiet work time.
cons: Like any company transitioning from a small startup to a mid-size company (EventBrite has been around 10 years now) it is experiencing some growing pains. I don't think this is very alarming, compared to early stage startups.

headline: product design tittle
pros: it's a fun place to work
cons: don't have a competitive salary

headline: Awesome Work Environment
pros: Eventbrite has an excellent balance of hard working employees with amazing culture.  No one is to busy to help you out, and everyone takes the time to introduce themselves to a new person.  The culture here is incredible.  Not only that, but our product is awesome and we are all inspired by the work we do.
cons: Not in the best area of San Fran

headline: INCREDIBLE team and company
pros:
From the moment I started interviewing with Eventbrite, my experience has been nothing but great. 99% of people who work here are bright, warm and thoughtful - everyone works very hard but there is definitely a work/life balance most times. I constantly talk about the culture here to my friends and most of them are dying to work here.

I've had a few other jobs before and haven't come across such a solid team or workplace until I worked here. There is a balance of everything you'd want in a workplace: fair management, open work environment, flexible work schedule, delicious lunch, dogs everywhere you look...I can go on and on.
cons: There was a bit of turnover over the past few months but in my opinion that will happen at most mid-size startups. Would also be nice to have a 401k plan with a matching benefit.

headline: Dream Team
pros: Could be talking regarding the pros all day, but I will summarize in a nutshell, Eventbrite soon became part of my life , where I am part of the dream team , with professionals with above-average level , real stars that all work day strongly to shine more and more , and all freedom we have to put into practice our ideas and confiaça to always develop the best.
cons: I was thinking but did not find anything as negative , just like warning 'll let the freedom we have to work and behave within the company, this for a great ally , more can also be something if you do not know enjoy slow you down.

headline: Software Engineer
pros:
People are so great to work with! Atmosphere of friendliness is off the charts.
Food in the SF office is very tasty! Especially breakfasts with pancakes.
Love the "take the time you need" policy.
Other many good things including beautiful view from the SF office.
cons: Missing or slow on some critical essential functionality for customers. A lot of work to do here!

headline: Great place to Work!!!
pros: No doubt about it, it's challenging as we are growing fast.  Eventbrite has a incredible focus on culture.  Best aspect is the focus on continued education.  They truly want you to grow, and provide and environment in which you can.
cons: It's a very competitive industry, and some might say broken.  While Eventbrite fights the good fight, and aims to disrupt, many users are stubborn and their priorities are in the wrong place.

headline: I Love my Job!
pros: This place has so much more to offer than just the perks (free lunch, breakfast, transportation stipend, wellness, take the time you need, etc...) The culture is nothing short of amazing. The people of Eventrbrite are fantastic. It's hard to be away from the office more than a few days. The culture is motivating, fun, and ever changing.  Exciting things are coming to the Briteland and I feel very fortunate to be a part of something special.
cons: I don't have any cons thus far.

headline: Awesome tech culture
pros:
Great team of extremely apt and smart engineers. True experts in their fields. There is always opportunity to learn something new. 

Best practices actually implemented in the process. Which means that you can feel way more confident with your commits, having the safety net of code reviews and test coverage.

Generally good work/life balance. Unlimited PTO.
cons: Some expectancy of being always on, even after work hours.

headline: The best job ever!
pros: Beyond the "tech world" perks (food, wellness programs, dogs in the office, etc), I really enjoy the team culture at Eventbrite. Everyone is friendly, smart and collaborative. I feel like I am part of something here and that my opinion and ideas matter. It's nice to work in an environment that emulates innovation and teamwork.
cons: Nothing major comes to mind! There are a few kinks to work out with it being a young and rapidly growing company, but that's to be expected. All smiles here!

headline: They take care of you
pros:
Great culture, transparency and perks. Our managers are very communicative and we can ask anybody about how the company is going, anytime.

Pre-IPO stock and Open vacation policy, cattered lunches and dinners. Frequent happy hours, team offsites and learning opportunities (workshops, talks, etc.).
cons: Compensation below market on cash but high on stock options.

headline: Great company who are about their employees
pros:
- Mentoring approach for junior software engineers
- Great work environment 
- Set own hours
- unlimited time off (as long as you get your work done of course)
- great co-workers
- great benefits
- great stock options
cons: It is sometimes hard to manage time frames for pushing code out due to the code review process and standards.

headline: Great Culture and Learning Opportunity
pros:
- People are smart and motivated - great to work with!
- Fun culture. Leaders at the company prioritize making it a good culture.
- Lots of autonomy and opportunity to share ideas and run with them
cons:
- Lean resources, so not everything can get done or prioritized
- Departments can sometimes operate in a silo

headline: Nashville Software Company That "Gets It"
pros: Eventbrite is one of the upcoming crop of companies in Tennessee that understands what it takes to build an environment for software engineers to be productive and learn.  There's a real shot to make big change and what you can do is only limited by the energy you want to put into getting things done.
cons: I wish they would have been in town a while back.

headline: Holy Awesome, Batman!
pros: There are so many! Let's start with the fact that we have unlimited time off...BAM! Then let's talk about how open, honest and transparent our leadership team is. A weekly Heart to Hartz with our cofounders? POW! Freedom and autonomy to make creative decisions while working with awesome people...ZAP! Topping it off with free meals that are super tasty and the fact that there are dogs in our office...BANG!
cons: It's a developing and growing company so careers paths can be unclear...BIFF! We're kind of like an awkward teenager and experiencing some growing pains. Our processes aren't always buttoned up which can cause duplication of efforts or confusion...ZONK!

headline: Account Manager
pros:
+ Great people- smart, hire well
+ Global business, growing almost despite ourselves
+ Great work life balance
+ Tangible product
cons:
- lack of opportunity to grow internally
- social capital gets things done, have to know the right people

headline: Great people and opportunities if you create them for yourself!
pros: Great people to work with and lots of autonomy. As the company evolved there were a lot of opportunities that arose. If you are driven and dedicated you can go far.
cons: There is a general lack of direction and accountability. The company grew really rapidly and there are some fundamental issues that need solving. Very reactive environment. It would be beneficial to pause, solve for current infrastructural issues, then start planning for the future instead of chasing after the next shiny ball without fixing anything. Leadership is not unified and getting people to adopt to core processes is a challenge.

headline: Nice workplace but company needs direction
pros: Company has a warm environment, and everyone is genuinely nice and welcoming.  The perks are great, especially the "take the time you need" vacation policy.
cons: Company needs more cross-functional leadership to drive forward.  Technical leadership from the early days have moved on and there is a gap of knowledge between old and new systems.  It's stuck in a growth phase right now where each department is working mostly in silos.

headline: Literally the best
pros: One of the best companies I've ever worked for. The work-life balance is great. The benefits are top notch. And I literally hate no one in the office, they're just too easy to get along with!
cons: Every growing company has growing pains and Eventbrite is no different. That being said, it does a great job at correcting itself and adapting to new trends / techniques in management / growth strategies / the list goes on.

headline: Good atmosphere
pros: Keen interest from senior management in digital efforts.
cons: Rounds of redundancies in recent years invariably made people a little tense.

headline: Great team, great challenges, room for growth
pros:
Lots of smart people, great chances to learn and grow.
Benefits are great, wish pay was a little higher, but it's somewhat balanced out by the options which isn't common in Nashville.
cons: From my perspective, there are very few cons. Communication with the home office in San Francisco can sometimes be a challenge due to the time zone difference, and the fact that people there tend to come in late (and work late). That sometimes means that it can be 10/11am before any other engineers are available for discussions.

headline: The best place I've ever worked
pros:
Eventbrite is a people-first company, and it's the only employer I've had where I've felt TRULY cared for. Beyond the "tech benefits" of the meals, smoothies, yoga, massages, manicures, etc, it is an incredibly supportive and open work culture. 

Leadership takes time for both small and large group meetings where tough topics are discussed with transparency and input is genuinely solicited. Work-life balance is celebrated and most people leave my department by 5:30pm (amazing!), but that's in part because everyone works incredibly hard - and smart - all day. That expectation of hard work is part of what I love about Eventbrite, because the people are motivated, high achievers who are used to accepting nothing but success. I LOVE my co-workers and even on the most stressful days I am happy to be in the office with them.
cons: In general, there is a sentiment that salaries/bonuses are low compared to other tech companies. There is also not a 401k match (yet). However, stipends for transportation, wellness, great team offsite events and free meals do help.

headline: Make it happen!
pros:
Eventbrite is a great company to work for.
If you have an idea, radical or not you are given the time and freedom to work on it and 'Make it happen'. I feel that this really helps to boost the company's product and overall engineer happiness.
cons: The company culture is very pep-eee and sometimes feels a little over the top.

headline: Eventbrite allows the freedom to produce great work
pros: The values core to Eventbrite are always in the forefront and never compromised.
cons: Wish there was more outward talk of bonuses raises or incentives

headline: Fantastic work environment in a mid-early-stage startup
pros: Eventbrite is a successful company with a mission and product that I am inspired by. The leadership and management layers are both incredibly transparent, which I also value quite a bit. My peers are almost always will to help out wherever they can. I really enjoy that we don't have everything figured out yet, as that means there is a lot of possibility to make big impact for the business.
cons: We're in our "teenager phase" of being a small, private start-up. We're around 500 employees so we don't quite have that scrappy, know everyone's name feel, but we don't have all of the benefits of a more mature company (more standardized procedures and tools, etc). This can be a potential con for people looking for more predictability and clarity in their day-to-day.

headline: Good for junior staff looking to get experience, others might want to think twice.
pros:
- Founders and management were all really cool and approachable.
- Vacation policy was pretty awesome (possibly the best perk there)
- Engineering mostly moved at a pretty good pace compared to other companies.
- Engineering leadership were smart and qualified for their jobs (which is always nice).
cons:
- The business domain of online ticketing isn't as cool in 2015 as it was when Eventbrite was founded and Eventbrite is no longer a startup or a disruptor. Eventbrite is a peacetime company now. For me, this was a con.
- Probably the most frugal company in all of San Francisco. If you're used to dual Apple monitors and frequent company outings, this isn't the place for you.
- Lots of major Kool-aid drinkers across the entire company.
- Python and Django as the hammer to every nail.
- Some engineering teams would frequently shoot themselves in the foot by hiring very junior staff that required LOTS of training during periods where resources were insanely stretched thin. Which is great for the Jr staff, but bad for employees that have equity in the company. 
- Architecture was the concern of an oligarchy called the "architecture team". Do you have experience with software design and SOAs? Too bad if you're not on that team.
- "No" as the knee-jerk reaction to most requests asked of Ops. Which is common to most companies, but worth mentioning that Eventbrite Ops is no different.

headline: Open, Organic, Professional Company
pros:
- Bright and open working environment
- Central Location, Downtown San Francisco
- Wonderful perks benefits and meals
- Strong sense of belonging, friendly people and culture
- Use of cutting edge technology and software development paradigms
- Fully transparent relationships between employees and management
cons:
None I can think of
(maybe salary is just a smidge less($1-$2) then other bay area companies but I've no reason to complain, it's still a ridiculous amount of money)

headline: Smart, passionate people!
pros: What makes me enjoy going to work everyday is the people.   There is an energy around getting things done without alot of overhead and a drive to keep it that way even as we continue to grow.
cons: So many things we want to do. .. not always enough the resources to do it

headline: Great company to learn
pros:
Great company culture
Cares about employee growth
Great work/life balance
cons: Salaries somewhat below market rate

headline: Good vision, poor execution
pros: I was on the engineering team.  The company vision overall is great, and the majority of the leaders were great.  It was an exciting place to work.
cons: At least while I was there, it was almost mandatory that you were happy and social at all times.  It was a bit much.  Further, the engineering team was pretty messy.  I know a lot of people that were there during this time have left, so perhaps things have changed.

headline: Exciting and challenging company, wonderful place to work
pros:
great team culture
flexible and generous perks
talented and outgoing coworkers
company is growing
cons:
a little bit of a cultish culture
growing pains, not always clear career development
less than industry average salaries

headline: Great people and company. Positive, balanced work environment.
pros:
- Highly capable people 
- Few/No bad apples
- Fun environment 
- Work/life culture is balanced
cons:
Very few.
- Compensation was fair but not outstanding
- Lacked guidance at times - Typical of a small/growing business.

headline: Great place to grow
pros:
-Small enough to still feel startup-y
-Big enough to have security and people with industry experience
-Great benefits
cons: Large enough where you won't know everyone.

headline: Field Operations Intern
pros: Great company to work for. Loved the culture
cons: Not enough structure in the internship program

headline: Great people, cool office, good place to grow
pros: Office is fantastic, cool people, tons of perks, unlimited PTO, plenty of autonomy and room for self guided opportunities. DOGS AND CATERED LUNCHES!!
cons: Not small enough to retain that scrappy startup vibe, not big enough to be very organized. Not a whole lot of room for growth within the company, as they tend to hire new managers as opposed to promoting them internally.

headline: Great place to work.
pros: Great benefits and everyone is happy
cons: there's so much happiness that you get pressured to be happy when sometimes might not be.

headline: Great Place To Work
pros: Great culture, awesome perks & benefits, good training
cons: Office not large enough to hold employees. Working from home is great but I'd like a little more flexibility.

headline: Truly wonderful company to work for - especially for new moms
pros:
Eventbrite is the most genuinely "people first" company I've ever worked for. From the top down there's a huge emphasis on hiring the right people and investing in them to keep them around for a long time. It's the first job I've had where I can picture my career growth very long term, and plan to be here for as long as I can. 

The totally unique amazing thing they have (that I've never heard of another company, let along tech company) having is such amazing support for new moms. They were great about supporting my maternity leave and transition back and, this is the kicker, they have the most amazing "Mom Rooms" ever. There are two rooms that both have hospital grade pumps (!!!) that they give you personal parts for. There's a fridge, a cushy arm chair, and basically everything you need to be a breastfeeding and working Mom. It's out of control awesome. It's made the challenge of breastfeeding while working full time much easier, and made me much less nervous to come back. 

There are a lot of other great perks (great catering, a smoothy bar with two vitamixes, yoga and massage). A lot of other tech companies have these but I feel like the over riding difference is the clear investment in employee wellness and work life balance.
cons: The only thing to mention is that salaries are a shade lower than some similar tech companies. I can say pretty confidently that the benefits, perks, and flexibility compensate almost entirely for the difference.

headline: New Briteling Loves the Briteland!
pros:
Best work culture I've experienced in my life. Everyone is so friendly, positive, and loves their job/this company.
Great benefits/perks, great food, amazing office.
Management treats you like an adult and expects you to act like one - mutual respect is the norm.
cons: If you don't want a big company with lots of loud personalities, this may not be the place for you. As a friendly/talkative people-person, however, this has not been an issue for me!

headline: "Make it happen" people flourish in the Briteland
pros:
- The customer support department has a "work from anywhere" policy that's changed my work-life balance for the better. Being told, collectively, that we work as one team regardless of physical location has changed our individual work habits and enabled us to all accomplish more at and outside of work.
- We only hire smart, capable people here who are also really nice and ego-free more often than not, which means you'll really like working with others here.
- I feel like there's room to grow within the company so I don't worry about working myself out of a job.
- We're encouraged to solve problems without asking for permission.
- Quarterly hackathons
- Catered meals every day (most lunches, cold breakfast always available, some hot dinners) and snacks/beverages
- Dog-friendly office
- Transportation and wellness stipends
- Pick-up for FedEx, USPS, UPS
cons:
- Sometimes middle management isn't great at communicating e-staff vision to the "doers" and bringing back feedback from their reports to higher management.
- Our processes as a company are still very much a work in progress, which means sometimes things can feel chaotic
- Sometimes "making it happen" requires resources you don't control and it can be hard to get what you need to solve a problem

headline: Best Place I've Ever Worked!
pros: This company is forward-thnking and on the brink of something amazing.  In my first 30 minutes as an employee, I felt more welcome than anywhere else I have ever worked.  The benefits are amazing and having the ability to work from home has been a life saver for me.  I also love that there is open communication from the top as well as across teams.
cons: In working from home, I sometimes feel disconnected.  We do have team meetings where we come together, but there is something to be said for in-office bonding as well.  This is also a very young company, and by that I mean that most of the people here are young, including leadership.  Nothing wrong with that except that as an older adult, I sometimes feel I am unable to relate.

headline: Well managed, dynamic, Brite future
pros:
The culture here is fun. They hire for personality and integrity here, so people tend to trust each other and get along well. Even as the company grows, it feels like a big family, thanks to our president Julia Hartz, whose job is creating employee love for for company.

Company integrity is job 1. There's a reason you don't read bad news or rumors about Eventbrite on Valleywag.

Great office location at 5th & Mission, one block from BART and adjacent to Westfields and the Metreon. 

Excellent future for this company.
cons: Internal communications aren't the best. Sometimes you find out about things after the fact. The company relies on Google+ and email for internal sharing, and it doesn't always go great.

headline: Great, fun, rewarding place to work!
pros: I love the people I work with.  Everyone is fun and energetic and nice.  I love that the company lets you be you and gives you time to do so.
cons: We don't have a 401(k) matching plan yet, but I'm sure it will come eventually.

headline: Eventbrite is definitely a great place to work
pros: The benefits are amazing, the training is world class, and above all the environment is conducive to growing while being yourself
cons: Too many people with too many ways to do things results in people trying to correct you because you aren't doing it their way even though your way is also correct and works well.

headline: So Happy To Be On The Briteside!
pros: Eventbrite is the first company I have worked for that really cares about employee moral & well-being. Every day I am learning something new and always know that If I need help I can pretty much ask anyone without feeling like I am taking up too much of their time. You get the days off that you want, pick the shifts that you want to work, and get to work with awesome people!
cons: No complaints at this time

headline: Better than most places to work
pros: The Founders have a vision and they are going to get us there.  They drive employees and while sometimes we have to bring them back to reality, its the visionaries (not the rational ppl out there) that go big.  The new office is really nice and convenient to get to, I never have to think about what to eat (even if the food isn't always what I would pick....) and if there is something you need (resource, equipment, etc) to get your job done better/faster/etc. you can get it.  Its nice not to have effectiveness limited by tight budget of limited cash flows.  I also appreciate the transparency and tone of leadership towards the rest of the company.  Kevin and Julia are completely approachable and WANT to hear what the employees (at any level) have to say.
cons: This is a real company with big goals and huge initiatives on tight timelines, ie means there is a lot of work to get done and not a lot of time to do it.  Just because this is a shiny happy start-up that treats people well, employees or potential employees need to know while people certainly play hard around here, working hard until your job is "done" is the expectation (ie this is not a 9-5 gig).  This is not truly a con, however, i think its important to point out that the perception of a startup always being "fun fun fun" is not the reality.  This is still a job and it is still work people!

headline: Enjoyed working for Google, but LOVE working for Eventbrite even more!
pros:
I've been at the company, full time, for several years - here goes:

Transparency - I love how everything is communicated to the employees and how often updates are sent out. This manifests in company all hands meetings, emails, exposure to Kevin (CEO) and Julia (President) since they sit at a regular table on the main floor like all other employees, and even a "heart to hartz" where you can ask them any question about the company, goals, etc.

Leadership - Management is pretty awesome and the board, executive staff, and VPs are all very smart and make great decisions. Also doesnt hurt that Julia reaaaaaally cares about people and office morale and makes sure that "wellness" is a top company priority. 

Equity/company success - I believe the company will do really well as it scales internationally and across many verticals. Its pretty nice to have equity in a soon-to-IPO company that will be massively successful. 

Growth opportunities - People move around all the time. If you're a hard worker you can jump to other positions either by moving teams, or being promoted. Its awesome how Eventbrite helps its employees do what they love.

Perks - free food/snacks/beer, dogs in office, massage, yoga, acupuncture, nap room, games room, tons of offsites, opportunities to join groups for sports or similar interests, great medical/dental, wellness and transportation stipend, unlimited vacation days via a "take the time you need" approach, and best of all - SMART PEOPLE that are humble and fun to work with (yes, I hang out with my team outside of work because I enjoy their company!)
cons: I've been at the company for several years and have seen how people who underperform get fired (which is fair to do), but the manner in which its communicated to employees/team members can be done better.

headline: New Part-Time CSR Employee in Nashville
pros: The people, the culture, the product, ALL THE THINGS. The hiring process was very efficient and they did not waste time asking the same questions different ways, repeatedly. They really know who they are looking for and seek them out. Persnoally,  I feel really at home here and everyone is very warm and supportive. Their transparency really makes you feel like you're WITH them all the way. Also, there are snacks.
cons: Office is a bit small for so much rapid growth (but as we can work from home, that isn't so bad!) at the new Nashville location, parking at hotel (for training) and outside the office (only a few allotted spots) might get a bit difficult/expensive.

headline: Great Company! Growing but Priorities are right!
pros:
If you are looking for a company that values it's people and the growth of it's employees this is it. If you are looking for a company that is willing to empower you with all the tools needed to make a difference in the customers world this is it. If you are looking for a company that really stands true to it's spoken values then this is it. 

It is a young company with so much growth potential and it is growing into a Love Brand quickly.
cons: My only fear is that it will begin to take shape to that of Apple. As a former employee I saw a company that strived for excellence but forgot what it meant to take care of it's employees! Many people left Apple to be apart of Eventbrite because our Founders understand that if the employees are well cared for then they will care for the customers and it will come naturally!

headline: So thankful for the opportunity to work at Eventbrite!
pros:
-High value placed on giving feedback
-Great culture of personal and team growth and improvement
-Employees feel valued
-Office has a fun, friendly culture and employees hang out a lot after work
-Great communication across all offices
-Thorough training
cons: -It's a fast growing company, so salaries haven't quite caught up to the growth yet, but that's true of most successful startups

headline: The most genuine coworkers and supportive environment that I've ever encountered.
pros:
* Colleagues are supportive and always willing to help you learn a new skill or contribute their expertise to a project. People are not territorial or competitive at all. There is team spirit in the truest sense (not just as a catchphrase).
* Everyone is genuinely friendly and cares about you as a person. I've made "real life" friends with many of the people I've worked with. Going to work is actually fun! At the same time, there is absolutely no forced socialization or expectation that you need to "fit in" -- as a general rule everyone is very accepting and welcoming.
* The degree of transparency is very high -- founders have weekly chats with the entire company where any question can be asked and will be answered. There is a minimum of office politics.
* Good work-life balance: unlimited PTO, managers encourage work life balance and there isn't a culture of staying in the office until midnight.

I've worked at 3 different companies before this, and can honestly say that Eventbrite is my favorite by far.
cons: Compensation tends to be on the modest side, although in line with industry standards. Also balanced out by the fact that we get unlimited PTO, good work life balance, etc -- versus other places with higher compensation but a cutthroat work culture.

headline: Inspiring vision, fun culture and smart people
pros: While the company has been around for 8 years, it's still run like a startup. People are expected to take calculated risks and rewarded for the learnings that come from them.  Having a founder focus on resourcing and fueling the culture is fantastic, and something that is felt across the company.  The vision is crystal clear, and inspiring to the Britelings.
cons: We need to look for more ways for leaders and aspiring leaders to grow into leadership and executive roles. The company is very thin at the top, which can have advantages, but is also limiting for senior employees looking to grow.

headline: Empowering and Inspiring
pros: Britelings are continuously empowered and inspired to make their visions happen. Whether you want to create a crazy and wacky marketing campaign or find new ways to bring the Britelings together outside of work, there is no one stopping you. If it's successful, you're recognized. If it fails, you learn from it and are encouraged to share those learnings with your team.
cons: I currently have no cons.

headline: I feel honored and lucky to work at Eventbrite
pros: I feel a true sense of autonomy with the ability to make decisions and develop ideas.  These ideas are honored and have impacted the business, which is extremely rewarding.  The transparency is unlike any place I've worked before and our cofounders are always accessible.  We're building a wonderful product that is inline with the success of our customers.  Most importantly, I have the absolute pleasure of working with incredibly smart people who are the best at what they do.
cons: No 401K was matching in place.

headline: Incredible company that cares about its employees!
pros: I am so excited that Eventbrite chose Nashville as their second US location.  They hire incredible people who are a blast to work with, and the benefits are outstanding (at least for those of us coming from outside of the tech world).  I look forward to growing with the company and seeing, specifically, how Nashville's office continues to evolve.
cons: Honestly, I don't have any cons yet.

headline: Ownership
pros: This company encourages the 'make it happen' spirit by providing ownership in the product that you make. There isn't tons of bureaucratic red tape as many of the executive are down to earth and available.
cons: As any other growing company, scaling the product to meet the needs of the world are always a challenge. Adapting can cause uneasiness, leading to attrition.

headline: An amazing place to be mission-driven and grow your career
pros: A clear vision and strong mission is conveyed by the leaders and that permeates the entire team.  The culture is one of the most authentically strong cultures I've ever seen or heard of in this industry.  The people are dynamic, friendly, accessible, driven, and lifelong learners.
cons: As with any high growth company, I think that there will be more opportunity for leadership development and training in the future.

headline: Great blend for top talent and a fun, collaborative culture
pros:
The company is growing quickly
Top talent across the company
A culture that highly values teamwork
Lots of fun perks, including daily meals 
Reasonable hours
Transparency from the top
cons:
so many opportunities to pursue, can sometimes lack company-wide focus
sometimes different parts of the company don't communicate well with others, leading to duplicate efforts

headline: Briteland, a place to thrive!
pros: If you want to be in a place where you can have huge impact, then Eventbrite is for you.  My work life balance has never been better.  I also have the full support of everyone of the team.
cons: no real cons, just 1st world problems.  Waaa they dont feed me on Wednesdays.  lol

headline: Great Company with Countless Opportunities
pros: Great culture and a very collaborative workplace; the lack of bureaucracy and politics is refreshing. As Eventbrite grows, we are constantly facing new challenges and it is encouraging to see all employees pulling together to come up with innovate solutions.
cons: Some departments are becoming more "corporate" as they grow, but that comes with the territory as Eventbrite continues to grow. Compensation could be higher but the perks offer a good trade-off.

headline: A big company that still hold onto it's humility
pros: It's great being able to work with a company that hasn't grown to large that they forget who's important in the day to day functions of the business. Eventbrite has a great culture of independence and encourages employees to be unique. However, they actually make you feel welcome.
cons: They don't have a 401-K matching plan yet; but I can understand as they're still growing. Hopefully the new Nashville office can grow to a size that allows those who don't want to work from the option. Sign-up lists aren't very inviting.

headline: BEST company around!
pros: Eventbrite really brings to life the "Make it Happen Spirit!" Believe me, this is not your average company! Kevin & Julia are truly passionate about their customers and employees alike. Between generous benefits, an awesome work space, supportive staff and of course many other awesome perks (shhhhhh), Eventbrite has brought a whole new meaning to "love brand!"
cons: Hands down, just way too many amazing people in one office...it really should be a crime.

headline: A company culture you could only dream of
pros:
- People genuinely like coming to work here. It makes such a difference working with happy, fun people. 
- Challenging work. No lack of challenges. 
- Opportunities to grow and develop new skills, maybe even switch to a new career within the company.
- Amazing future for the company as far as growth and potential.
- Autonomy to make great ideas happen.
- The perks: unlimited paid time off, catered lunch 3x, breakfast x2, dinner x2, snacks, good benefits, wellness reimbursement.
cons:
- Bumps along the road in transitioning from a startup mindset to a more established company regarding quality vs speed.
- Some managers are less experienced.

headline: Amazing people, best career move I've ever made.
pros:
Filled with brilliant, but humble and approachable people.
Inspiring leaders.
Great cross team collaboration.
People I ACTUALLY want to be around - when I go to work I feel like I'm going to see all my friends. 
Carefully chosen perks that help you with a real work/life balance.
Transparency - I feel like I know what's going on with the organization.
cons: None I can really think of!

headline: great job
pros: I definitely work with some smart people
cons: Nothing at the moment. It's definitely the best job I've had to date.

headline: Amazing company to work for
pros:
Atmosphere-  You just can't beat the startup atmosphere at a very successful, well funded, and growing company.  It's contagious and makes you want to do all you can for the company.

Sales Organization-  The sales organization is structured for success and they do whatever is needed to help you succeed.  Everyone here is excited to jump on the phone and make deals happen.  As I mentioned before, it is very contagious.  Fun and interesting weekly contest with great incentives to keep everyone engaged.

Sales Management - Open to any and all ideas and in my short time here and I am already seeing my ideas being executed.  Makes me want to be constantly coming up with more.

Food: free lunch four days a weeks, breakfast twice a week, and dinner twice a week.  Many different kinds of drinks to choose from along with beer on tap and plenty of happy hour events

Office: We just moved into an amazing office downtown.  My desk has a view of the city.  The office is open and has many cool breakout areas.  Stand up desks are also available.  The stadium seating room is very cool and the conference rooms are different and unique.  Ping pong, video games, etc

Technology:  Having great technology make my job selling easier.
cons: No President's Club but I think we will get there.

headline: Fast track to success
pros:
Eventbrite has undergone sgnificant change in the last 12-months to continue to skyrocket to the top of our industry. it's been both exciting to watch and to participate in! 

As the company grows, leadership is getting really good at structuring career progression for its employees. In the year that I have been here, I've seen and experienced these changes first hand and it's been awesome. The company values and responds well to all feedback, which should encourage employees to speak up and work for what they want. Tons of growth potential and the roles are lined up to launch people forward and to the top.

The new office is a dream as well!
cons: Hoping 401k matching is in the near future ...

headline: Great Culture and Dynamic team
pros: The company has grown tremendously and has certainly found its "voice".  The team is dynamic, smart, interesting and aligned to grow and push into new spaces.  They encourage employees to take control of their career and embrace the ideas and interests that are presented.  The benefits are amazing and they have remained an employee centric company
cons: We don't know everyone in the company's name anymore but that is what happens when you grow.

headline: A place where you truly enjoy coming to work everyday!
pros:
- Opportunities to learn and grow within the organization
- A strong focus on work/life balance
- Collaborative team culture
- Awesome benefits and employee perks (and a sweet new office!)
- Open communication with leadership
- Overall, a truly exciting and fun place to work!
cons: As with any growing company, there are growing pains. Figuring out processes and solutions as we grow and scale the team in SF and expand internationally.

headline: Senior Account Executive
pros: Great company. Great culture.  Company will be successful.
cons:
Career Progression:
In sales there is no real career progression. As you advance, the quota gets larger, commission rates decrease, and the prospect quality / deal sizes stay the same. 

Leadership:
In the past year, the leadership has shifted the culture in Sales. It's gone from a very entrepreneurial environment to a heavily micro-managed team. I've got this as a con, as only a certain type of sales persona enjoys being micro-managed. 

Commission:
If you do decide to go to Eventbrite, be ready to reconcile every paycheck, as they are still ironing out tracking deals. Every month, my commission came in short and had to be corrected.  I surfaced the issue and was told to keep reconciling until they got a better handle on tracking. Hopefully this has been corrected.

headline: All Smiles At Eventbrite
pros: Eventbrite has a lot of great training resources.  The Sales Team especially puts in a lot of extra effort to provide training tools and one of one time to really understand how to be successful in the role.
cons: Eventbrite is very ambitious when it comes to going after new markets.  This means that the quota expectations are extremeley agressive.

headline: Good work experience
pros:
