Overall a very good experience. It's great to be surrounded by such a smart group of people. 
Transparent business environment. The company really cares about fostering the culture and it is obvious that people are an important asset to the business. Rich benefits package.
cons:
Leadership team still developing
Career path lack clarity

headline: Work hard, play hard - focus on team as well as bottom line
pros:
- Fun, complex and diverse industry - lots to learn across multiple event spaces and growing exponentially
- Growing quickly both domestically across different segments and internationally into new markets
- Lots of dynamic, challenging work to tackle which can help keep things fresh and new
- Given lots of autonomy to go after opportunities and drive decisions
- Smart people who have fun, are passionate about the business, and who work really hard
cons:
- Primarily young management team lacking big company experience to facilitate growth to the next level
- Limited upward mobility for middle management and real focus on employee career growth
- Lower end of compensation for market - they like to sell the dream to get you in
- Culture, while super fun, up beat and friendly outwardly, discourages confrontation causing management to often skirt around issues instead of being direct and upfront

headline: Love this place!
pros: The best thing about working at Eventbrite is the truly lived philosophy of engaging employees with the business in real and meaningful ways on a daily basis.  It is an incredibly mission driven organization populated with people who are passionate about making a difference.  We also have a lot of fun doing it.
cons: I can't really think of any cons that go beyond the usual small workplace problems.  That being said, if you are not the type of person who likes the ability to define your own scope of work, being responsible for your success, exercising personal agency, and tackling difficult problems you will not thrive in this environment.

headline: Fun company
pros: The office environment is open and friendly, the people are dynamic and interesting. Unlimited PTO is awesome.
cons: It's often hard to understand what your career path is or what exactly a next step would be.

headline: Eventbrite is a collection of amazing, engaged people that inspire me every day.
pros: Positive, engaged, smart people to work with.
cons: There is a commute for me but sooooo worth it.

headline: Loved it, sad to leave
pros: Great community, awesome for customer support
cons: they misinterpreted their staffing needs

headline: Great People - Great Product - Great Company
pros:
You are surrounded by really smart people who ware working to make a difference.
Lots of perks - catered meals, dog friendly office, tons of snacks and quiet work places.
cons: We are growing too fast - I can't keep up with all the new names and faces around the office!

headline: The work you do is appreciated
pros:
- Feeling appreciated and treated with respect motivates me to do my best everyday.
- The people make the difference 
- Vibrant work environment
cons: - Nothing really. Perhaps too many meetings and not enough time in the day.

headline: Amazing culture and a great place to work
pros:
- Highly collaborative environment
- Feels like family
- Great perks, including catered meals, amazing benefits, ridiculously fun hosted events, and so much more
- Lots of room to learn and grow
- The company has hit some serious milestones recently, which makes it a truly exciting time to be a Briteling
cons:
- Not too many downsides, it's a very transparent organization from the top down
- Lot's of recent growth, getting harder to know every name and face

headline: The team at Eventbrite is second to none in every way.  A perfect 10.
pros: Culture, Onboarding and training process, Product,
cons: Catered gourmet meals are too delicious!

headline: Great people, great product!
pros: Eventbrite has incredibly talented, driven, intelligent employees which makes for an exciting and fast-paced working environment.  The culture is fun and still feels start up-y even though we are growing and close to 300 employees.  There is a lot of encouragement for growth - both professionally and intellectually.  Plus, we genuinely love our product and are proud of the work that we get to put out!
cons: I don't really have any negatives to add.  The only one that comes to mind is that a lot of managers are first time managers, so there can be some bumps in the road; however, there is ongoing growth, training and education, which helps strengthen their skills.

headline: Intelligent colleagues + awesome product = my dream job
pros:
Everyone who works at Eventbrite most likely had to meet with one of the co-founders as part of the interview process, so you know that you working with very talented individuals.

Not only is everyone smart, but they are also down-to-earth! Having a dog friendly atmosphere and catered meals also helps build a great sense of community amongst the Britelings.
cons: No real cons other than there is A LOT of work to be done, so you have to be good with prioritization, organization and communication to be successful here.

headline: Great culture lacking good senior leadership.
pros:
- Free lunches
- Great culture
- Unlimited PTO
cons:
- Senior leadership
- Little to no career progression
- Values don't represent actions within the company

headline: Fantastic Coworkers, Flawed Company
pros: Most of the people at the "bottom of the pyramid" are incredibly talented and nice.  The product and vision are great and you can feel the love from the customers.  And who doesn't want to fix the fees disaster that is live event ticketing?
cons: The company is a strange combination of a startup and a wannabe public company - low pay and loose structure of a startup but inflexibility and bureaucratic slowdowns of a large company.  With a few exceptions, your manager's job is to smile for the entire year until your yearly review, where you'll be told something isn't quite right and you haven't earned a raise.

headline: This company is growing, a lot of fun day to day, great people, and a lot of upside to the future.
pros: Great product, the co-workers are all very close even at 250+ employees, the culture speaks volumes.
cons: Career path and promotions aren't traditional as expected in a startup environment.  Don't plan on just getting a raise/promotion for doing your job every 6 months to a year.

headline: Fun and exciting place to work!
pros:
Amazing team - everyone is super friendly and outgoing and there is a super positive team spirit

Perks - (delicious) food and snacks everyday, comfy and quirky meeting rooms, fantastic location, the list goes on and on

True to values - a main value of Eventbrite is transparency, and they always stay true to that. There is an open forum for asking questions about the goings-on of the company and transparency is 100% to both employees and site users.
cons: Depends on what you're looking for, but as it grows, it is losing some of its more "start-up" qualities...so take that for what you will.

headline: customer support through multiple channels
pros: This company has great benefits, travel compensation, health & wellness stipend, catered lunch. Great team building exercises, frequent meetings. Great culture.
cons: You have to sit for long periods and stay in front of a computer screen. Really stagnant and repetitive.

headline: From someone who has worked at start ups to enterprise level companies & was part of the dot com era, I've seen a lot.
pros: The ability to make things happen is truly embraced. Rarely do you find a place where you can grow professionally, have fun doing it and be part of something that is truly revolutionary.  The secret....it's the people (shhhhh!!)
cons: We have windows but if I have to be nitpicky, add a few more to let in even more light. Big Brite orange walls, an open floor plan and, for the most part, all of us on one floor make it an ideal work environment for me. At the end of the day, it's not where you work but who you work with.

headline: A friendly, collaborative, high-energy and orange-tinted work environment.
pros:
-Opportunity to work with some of the smartest, most creative and coolest colleagues I’ve ever encountered. 
-Highly collaborative spirit, everyone has something to contribute. 
-They care deeply about company culture and put a lot weight on having fun.
-Great perks: catered lunches every day, catered breakfasts & dinners four times a week. Unlimited snacks & goodies, dog-friendly office, kegs, unlimited PTO, yoga, massages etc.
-Location: office in the middle of SF.
cons:
-Catered lunches mean you often don't leave the office all day. 
-Long hours, a lot for each team to take on.

headline: Very transparent place to work
pros:
The employees sincerely care about what they do each day.  They're bright, motivated and highly collaborative.   
There is a can-do attitude that is a huge part of the culture.
The employees are some of the most sincere, happy, helpful,outgoing and talented people I've ever worked with.
Employees enjoy working shoulder to shoulder each day and get things done.
While there is process in place, we're not smothered by it.
The conference rooms just became a whole lot cooler.
There are two kegbots and a healthy ping-pong community.
I love that I can bring my dog to work and know that he loves it at Eventbrite too.
There are zero phony people at Eventbrite.    What you see is what you get.
cons:
I'm hoping that the culture that exists today is not impacted negatively by the company's continued growth.  I don't think it will be.  The hiring bar is incredibly high and cultural fit is a big part of that. 
Eventbrite hires brilliant people who are also a delight to be around. Can't go wrong with that combo.

headline: Great individual coworkers, bad management
pros: Some great coworkers. Free food. The office is in a great, central location in SF. Fun/social atmosphere. The product is amazing.
cons: Cut throat atmosphere. Drink the koolaid and get your cheerleader outfit on, or you lose your job. The problem was, it was exhausting trying to stay excited about this company when so many people were clearly unhappy. headline: Great atmosphere and wonderful people.
pros: Eventbrite was a great place to work- a wonderful group of people who were very friendly, very smart and worked well together.  They took very good care of their employees- daily catered lunches, many activities, upper management that knew everyone by name.
cons: The only negative is that I felt that I was trapped in my role and didn't have an opportunity to branch out and try other things that interested me.  This is OK for people who have achieved certainty in their careers but younger employees who are trying to figure out how they want to position themselves need more cross functional opportunities and career guidance.

headline: Exciting company with enthusiastic, smart people
pros: Eventbrite has a very fun and quirky culture. It's feels like a big family out to revolutionize the ticketing industry. And it's growing very fast, offering employees a great opportunity to make an impact.
cons: It's a relatively frugal company, so you're not going to get perks like in-office video game consoles and drumsets you might see at other startups of its size. But everyone has fun with what they're doing, so it doesn't matter that much in the end.
